item.title: By: Yonatan
item.dc:creator: Yonatan
item.description:
Evangelicals were always earlier adaptors of technology than mainline churches. Cf. Charles Fuller and Aimee Semple McPherson.
In fact, as noted by Joel Carpenter notes in Revive Us Again, technology served to unify the Fundamentalist movement in the period between the 1930's and 1950's and the rise of evangelicalism.
Chabad are just more evangelical in their religion than Orthodox Jews.
item.content:encoded:
Evangelicals were always earlier adaptors of technology than mainline churches. Cf. Charles Fuller and Aimee Semple McPherson.

In fact, as noted by Joel Carpenter notes in Revive Us Again, technology served to unify the Fundamentalist movement in the period between the 1930’s and 1950’s and the rise of evangelicalism.

Chabad are just more evangelical in their religion than Orthodox Jews.
